newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Trading diminishes before holiday.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Trading diminishes before holiday.

text.p: The after-hours trading session was quiet on the last day before the long weekend with dealers at a loss to report any noteworthy operations.
"I don't see anything right now," one trader said Friday.
Markets will be closed on Monday in observance of the Memorial Day celebrations.
Trading activity was much different during normal hours earlier in the day.
A wave of pre-holiday buying sent stocks soaring to their 20th record closing high on the year.

The Dow Jones industrial average ended 1.2 percent up to 7346, surpassing the May 15 record of 7333.55. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq composite index rose 1.25 percent to close at 1389.72, above its January 22 record of 1388.06.
